content: by fiori worked from point to point to create a stunning gradient shawl yarn 1 2 skeins fiori gradient sock hand dyed 50g needles 3 50mm needles gauge 38 st x 44 row for 10cm x 10cm pattern repeat for increasing side of shawl size row 1 k to last 3 stitches slip 3 necktie shawl -105cm 150cm finished row 2-5 repeat row 1 length row 6 k to last 4 stitches kfb slip 3 repeat this pattern until approx 26g 2g abbreviations yarn remain from your first skein ending on row 6 k-knit kfb-knit into the front and back of the same pattern repeat for decreasing side of shawl stitch row 1 k to last 3 stitches slip 3 k2tog - knit 2 stitches together row 2-5 repeat row 1 row 6 k to last 5 stitches k2tog slip 3 repeat decreasing pattern until 9 stitches remain finishing your shawl row 1 k to last 3 stitches slip 3 row 2 k3 cast off 3 slip 3 row 3 k3 slip these 3 stitches back onto left needle repeat row 3 for 3 more times using kitchener stitch graft the first 3 stitches and the last 3 stitches together set up cast on 3 stitches row 1 k3 slip stitches back onto left needle using the tail sew the 3 cast off stitches repeat 4 more times to create an icord onto the icord loop you have jut created weave in ends and block to desired size pick up and knit 3 stitches down the side of note you can aggressively block to get a your icord these stitches will become the much larger shawl if desired garter stitch section of the shawl pick up but don t knit 3 stitches along the cast on edge these stitches will become the icord edge © fiori yarns 2023
